entity_mention.mention_text: a founding member of the country’s once dominant socialist party
he most senior government official to stand trial since the former prime minister and Pasok founder, Andreas Papandreou, was acquitted in 1991 on charges of accepting bribes
the country’s once dominant socialist party
the former prime minister and Pasok founder
the former prime minister and Pasok founder
the political elite whom most Greeks blame for the dysfunctional state system that created the country’s huge debt problem and led it to dependence on foreign rescue loans
the government of Prime Minister Antonis Samaras

fillers.filler: setting up a complex money laundering network to cover the trail of millions of euros in bribes
setting up a complex money laundering network to cover the trail of millions of euros in bribes

using a network of offshore companies during his stint as defense minister between 1996 and 2001, and for several years after that, to siphon off millions of euros in bribes he is said to have taken in exchange for procurement contracts, including the purchase of a Russian missile defense system and German submarines
embezzling at least 18 million euros from city coffers
embezzling at least 18 million euros from city coffers
